title: [$250] Refactor: Extract confirmReadyToOpenApp into reusable hook

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
## Problem Multiple pages in the codebase contain duplicated `useEffect` patterns that call `confirmReadyToOpenApp()` on mount: ```tsx useEffect(() => { confirmReadyToOpenApp(); }, []); ``` This pattern appears in at least 10 pages: - `DomainInitialPage.tsx` - `SearchPage.tsx` - `HomePage.tsx` - `WorkspaceInitialPage.tsx` - `SidebarLinks.tsx` - `InitialSettingsPage.tsx` - `ConciergePage.tsx` - `Expensify.tsx` - And more... ### Rule Violations **CLEAN-REACT-PATTERNS-4 (Avoid side-effect spaghetti)** - Components mix unrelated effects (data fetching + app lifecycle) in the same file - The `confirmReadyToOpenApp()` effect is unrelated to the component's primary responsibility **CONSISTENCY-3 (Eliminate code duplication)** - The same 3-line `useEffect` pattern is copy-pasted across 10+ files - Any changes to this pattern would require updating all files ## Solution Extract the pattern into a reusable custom hook: ```tsx // src/hooks/useConfirmReadyToOpenApp.ts function useConfirmReadyToOpenApp(): void { useEffect(() => { confirmReadyToOpenApp(); }, []); } ``` Then replace all instances with: ```tsx useConfirmReadyToOpenApp(); ``` ## Benefits 1. **Single Responsibility**: Each component focuses on its own logic 2. **DRY**: One source of truth for the app lifecycle effect 3. **Self-documenting**: Hook name explains the intent 4. **Maintainable**: Changes to the pattern only need to happen in one place ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Create `useConfirmReadyToOpenApp` hook - [ ] Refactor pages with identical pattern to use the hook - [ ] Add unit tests for the hook - [ ] Document which pages should NOT use the hook (e.g., `Expensify.tsx` where it's part of a larger flow)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @eh2077
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022019925389820322806
  • Upwork Job ID: 2019925389820322806
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-07

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Version Number:** 9.3.15-2

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** biruknew45+exp11@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Web, mweb, android
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Precondition -
Issue a virtual card to an employee
Employee must use a new Gmail account (unvalidated)

1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Login as an employee
3. Go to the Accounts > Wallet
4. Click on the virtual card assigned by the Admin
5. Click on the "Report virtual card fraud" 
6. Deactivate the card
7. Enter the magic code and click on "Verify"(request magic code again if the first one doesn't work)
8. Close the RHP and see the virtual card
9. Go to the workspace chat

## Expected Result:
Step 7: Magic code should work on the first attempt and shouldn’t show a “wrong magic code” error.
Step 8: An error message shouldn’t appear below the assigned virtual card.
Step 9: The card replacement system message should appear, and a card hyperlink should be shown.

## Actual Result:
Step 7: Magic code fails on first attempt with a “wrong magic code” error.
Step 8: An error message appears below the assigned virtual card.
Step 9: The card replacement system message does not appear, and no card hyperlink is shown.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] Add a tooltip to train users that filter negation helps them find expenses without receipts

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
While we have a powerful set of search filters, getting used to them, like any set of filters takes time. Additionally, for most filters we support negation via the minus sign, but it's uncommon to show both regular filters and the inverse of those filters in the UI. Reason being, it's confusing to see things like receipt, missing receipt, category, missing category. Just as importantly, this makes it possible to negate your own search query (e.g. receipt, missing receipt). To combat this issue while still training users on the power of our search filters, we'd like to add a tool tip. The relevant details are: - Icon: lightbulb (green "success") - Text: "Search for expenses without receipts using -has:receipt." - Like all tooltips, this will be user-dismissible - We'll show the tooltip over the bottom drawer (mobile), or in the right-hand pane (desktop) - This tooltip only shows with in the `Has` filter

3.Click on add attachment
4.Attempt to upload an attachment that is larger than the 24 MB limit
5. Verify an "Attachment error" modal window appears

## Expected Result:
Page remains stable when attachment error appears during upload of large image

## Actual Result:
Page flashes when attachment error appears during upload of large image

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck25261@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Join as new user using Track intent
3. Create workspace
4. Go to workspace settings
5. Select Company cards
6. Select Commercial feed option
7. Select either Mastercard or Visa 
8. Enter details in add cards page 
9 Select Custom day of month & select any date >> Tap submit

## Expected Result:
No infinite loading appears. Commercial feed displayed in Company cards page

## Actual Result:
Infinte loading after submitting Commercial feed. This happens for new users when adding commercial feed company cards. Once the user log out & log back in issue get resolved

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Device used:** Windows 10/ Chrome
**App Component:** Chat Report View

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:  Create a workspace, enable approvals and payment and add a employee.
Bank account setup has a "Unfinished" setup and bank account is pending validation

Steps: 
1. As the employee, submit an expense to the workspace chat
2. As the admin, navigate to the workspace chat with the employee
4. Open the report details and approve the report
5. Verify the "Pay with Expensify" button is displayed in header
6. Verify the next steps indicate that "Waiting for [userAdmin] to finish setting up a business bank account"
     Result: Next step is "Waiting for you to pay expenses."

## Expected Result:
The next steps indicate that "Waiting for [userAdmin] to finish setting up a business bank account"

## Actual Result:
Next step is "Waiting for you to pay expenses."

## Workaround:
Unknown
